intro: Vanillosmopsis discolor, commonly known as the pink sandalwood, is a rare and endangered plant species native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, woody structure and distinctive pinkish-white bark. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are alternate and often covered in a fine, waxy coating. It produces fragrant, yellowish-green flowers followed by small, woody fruits containing a single seed. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
